channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Afghanistan: Major cities fall to Taliban amid heavy fighting
item.description: Militants now control many of Afghanistan's key regional cities, including Herat and Ghazni.

item.title: Life in a town taken by the Taliban in Afghanistan
item.description: BBC correspondent Secunder Kermani reports from a town in Afghanistan recently taken by the Taliban

item.title: Covid: Germany fears thousands got saline, not vaccine from nurse
item.description: More than 8,000 mostly elderly people are urged to get vaccinated again as a nurse is questioned.

item.title: Russia holds hypersonic flight expert in spy probe
item.description: Alexander Kuranov, detained by FSB agents, runs a team of pioneering spaceflight researchers.

item.title: Brazil Congress expels lawmaker over murder charges
item.description: Gospel singer turned lawmaker Flordelis de Souza is accused of ordering the murder of her husband.

item.title: UK and Russia ambassadors anger Iran by restaging WWII image
item.description: Iran condemns an "inappropriate" image of the UK and Russian ambassadors recreating a wartime image.

item.title: Tokyo Olympic gold medal replaced after first got bitten
item.description: The mayor of softball athlete Miu Goto's hometown prompted outrage after chomping on her medal.

item.title: Turkish capital reels from violent protests against Syrians
item.description: Protesters attacked houses owned by Syrians after tensions flared over reports of a fatal stabbing.

item.title: Picasso masterpieces to go on sale in blockbuster auction
item.description: Proceeds could reach $100m in what is thought to be the most valuable auction of the artist's works.

item.title: Wildfires rage in Algeria as heatwave hits North Africa
item.description: The blazes in the mountainous Kabylie region are some of the worst in the country's history.

item.title: Messi: What are the PSG fan tokens given to the footballer?
item.description: Paris St-Germain has given Messi a "large number" of fan tokens as part of his welcome package.

item.title: Seungri: Former K-pop star jailed for gambling and organising sex work
item.description: Seungri, whose former band Big Bang has sold 140 million records, is given a three-year prison term.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Taliban back brutal rule as they strike for power
item.description: Afghanistan's ex-rulers still back brutal punishments, the BBC finds as it goes behind Taliban lines.

item.title: Berlin embassy arrest: A case of old-school spying?
item.description: Why nothing in the case of the arrest of a man at the British Embassy in Berlin should surprise us.

item.title: How North American cities are bracing for more heatwaves
item.description: Local governments are getting creative when it comes to tackling frequent and extreme heat.

item.title: Kathy Hochul: Who is New York's first female governor?
item.description: The history-making Democrat will take the role after Andrew Cuomo resigned over harassment claims.

item.title: Wagner: Scale of Russian mercenary mission in Libya exposed
item.description: A Samsung tablet obtained by the BBC unveils chilling details of how mercenaries fought in Libya’s war.

item.title: The shopkeeper saving his island from wildfires
item.description: Spyros isn't a firefighter, but when his home was threatened with wildfires, he decided to take action.

item.title: Northern Turkey hit by severe flash flooding
item.description: Seventeen people have reportedly died, with more than 1,400 people evacuated from the areas affected.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Do the Taliban want to conquer or compromise?
item.description: The BBC speaks to two high profile figures in its chain of command who have very different messages.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Veterans reflect on troops leaving country
item.description: The two veterans have opposing views on whether the conflict has had a positive effect.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Meet Tokyo's youngest Olympic champion
item.description: Japan's Momiji Nishiya won the first women’s street skateboarding gold in the sport's Olympic debut.

item.title: The illegal gold mines killing rivers and livelihoods in Ghana
item.description: Sixty percent of Ghana's water bodies are now polluted, largely due to illegal mining operations.
